result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ydbi  Islami in court, in custody, with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea Will and  Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called as a calendar call with  14CF639. Asan Xhaferi is sworn-in and appears as Albanian Interpreter. Case called for Review hearing regarding 01/24/17 letter from the State regarding potential conflict for the Court. ADA Will makes requests that the court remain on the Defendant's cases. Atty Patrickus also requests that the court keep the Defendant's cases and states that the Defendant also makes that request. Court does not believe there is a conflict of interest and will keep the Defendant's cases.   March 8, 2017 hearing to remain as scheduled.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski.   Andrea M Will and Assistant Attorney General Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Albanian interpreter Asan Xhaferi appears as interprter and is sworn-in.  Court adjourned jury trial yesterday, 9/7/16 and parties are here today to set new trial date.  Both sides agree for 2 week trial to begin on January 30, 2017 (Monday) through February 10, 2017.  Court orders defense to file their witness list within 60 days, by November 8, 2016.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 08:30 am. Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski both appear by telephone.   Defendant Ydbi Islami's appearance is waived for today.   Andrea M Will and Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for status conference for request for adjournment of jury trial being requested by the defense.  State makes statements regarding time frame as to when they provided the defense with DVD's mentioned in adjournment request.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements.  Assistant Attorney General Duford makes statements in response to defense's comments.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements.  Court grants request and will adjourn jury trial scheduled to commence on Monday, September 12, 2016.   Court leaves jury status on for tomorrow, September 8, 2016.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski.  Andrea M Will and Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing.          Denada Cobani, Albanian interpreter is sworn-in as interpreter.  Court reviews issues from hearing on August 26, 2016 and August 17, 2016.  Attorney Duford makes statements.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements regarding waiver by Attorney Owens.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding having Attorney Paul Ksicinski continue to represent him.  Defendant states he wishes to continue to have Attorney Paul Ksicinski represent him.  Case proceeds to motions.  Attorney Duford makes statements regarding other acts motion.   Attorney Ksicinski makes arguments/responses to Attorney Duford's statements.  Attorney Ksicinski makes additional statements.  Court grants motion as to the 3 fires in question.  Attorney Ksicinski makes some clarifications.  Court denies motion for admission of evidence based on arguments.  Court addresses defense motion to admit medical/mental health records.  Attorney Ksicinski states that he withdraws special plea entered on 12/1/15.  Attorney Duford makes statements regarding this motion.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements in response to the state's comments.   Attorney Patrickus makes statements.  Court will allow street clothes for Defendant for trial.  Jury status and jury trial remain on.
Cover letter dated 08/30/16, filed by Atty Joseph Owens regarding Conflicts Waiver.
Conflicts Waiver Form Pursuant to SCR 20:1.7, filed by Atty Joseph Owens.
Hearing on September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski.   Andrea M Will and Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreters Asan Xhaferi and Entela Kosova appear and are sworn-in as interpreters for Defendant.  Case called for continued motion - continued from 8/17/16.  This case is adjourned along with Case #14CF639.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Exhibit #1 (DVD) and #2.
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski.   Andrea M Will and Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Albanian interpreters Asan Xhaferi and Entela Kosova appear as interpreters for Defendant and are sworn-in.  Interpreters will alternate thoughout hearings held today.  There are multiple motions filed by both parties and court inquires with parties as to suggestions as to how to proceed (which motions to be heard first).  State gives requests/recommendations.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements/recommendations in response to state's request.  Parties agree that first motion to be heard is motion to disqualify Attorney Paul Ksicinski.  Court proceeds on that motion.  Attorney Duford makes statements regarding motion to disqualify.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements/arguments regarding motion to disqualify.   Court takes matter under advisement.  Court addresses motion to suppress.   Attorney Duford makes statements.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements/responses to the states statements regarding motion to suppress.  Court takes short break.  Parties stipulate to not having Daubert hearing and agree to qualifications of Special Agent Hankins and that proper procedures were followed. State agrees to not use dog sniff during trial.  Court outlines rules for media coverage.  Case proceeds to testimony on motion to suppress addressed before break.  Deputy Tim Whitstone is sworn-in and testifies.  State's Exhibits #1 & 2 marked.  Exhibits #1 & 2 are offered and received.  Cross-examination by Attorney Patrickus.  Re-direct by Attorney Duford.  Re-cross-examination by Attorney Patrickus.  Attorney Duford moves for dismissal of motion to suppress.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements.  Additional statements by Attorney Duford.  Court denies motion to suppress defendant's statements given on 6/11/13.  Court is concerned with proceeding further with any other motions due to needing to rule on motion regarding disqualification of Attorney Ksicinski.  Attorney Ksicinski makes additional statements.  State makes comments regarding Attorney Ksicinski's statements. Court will take pending issues under advisement at this time. Court will set for continued Motion hearing on 08/26/16 at 130 pm. All parties, including both interpreters, are available. Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Scheduling Order. Signed by Judge Carter on 04/22/16.	

Any reports regarding fire cause and origin shall be filed no later than 4:30 p.m., Wednesday, June 15, 2016. 

Any other motions shall be filed no later than 4:30 p.m., Wednesday, August 8, 2016.

Any reports regarding NGI issues shall be filed no later than 4:30 p.m., Friday, August 12, 2016.

Court grants Motion to Order Attorney Patrickus' Certification for Public Defender Appointment and/or the Court's finding that it is in the interest and administration of justice for Patrickus to continue representing Ybdi Islami at public expense. Court also grants Motion requesting an extension of time to obtain a Defense Expert to conduct an evaluation of Mr. Islami in furtherrance of his NGI plea.   Signed by Judge Carter on 04/15/16.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus and Attorney Paul Ksicinski (will now be co-counsel). Attorney Patrickus inquires as to obtaining/retaining expert witnesses.  Attorney Patrickus also requests an adjournment of jury trial date set for 6/13/16 so she has more time to prepare. Court addresses motion to modify bail.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements regarding bail modification/reduction request.  State objects to any bail modification.  Attorney Ksicinski makes additional statements regarding bail modfication request.  Court denies motion to modify bail but will reconsider with more information provided to the court regarding facility defense is proposing to have Defendant reside at.     Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing date of 8/17/16 and 9/8/16 and 9/12/16.    Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 08:30 am. Order Denying - Defense Emergency Motion for Bail Modification.
Signed by Judge Lloyd Carter on 11/24/15.

Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ydbi  Islami in court, in custody, with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   
Albanian interpreter Asan (Sonny) Xhaferi appeared for the Defendant.  Sworn in.
Attorney Kimberly Haines appeared on behalf of Corporation Counsel.
Captain Meg Schnabl appeared on behalf of the Waukesha County Jail and Elizabeth Fredrick on behalf of the Medical Department of the Waukesha County Jail.
Motion filed by Defense - Emergency Motion for Bail Modification - (Claiming the Defendant is not getting proper medical care in the Jail).

State raised the issue that the defendant has not signed a release of information with the Jail Medical Department (without a waiver, the Jail and Medical Dept. can not discuss the defendant's medical issues with the State or the Court).
Atty. Patrickus presented statements to the court regarding that issue.
Defendant waives his right to medical privilege.
Court addressed the defendant's waiver of medical privilege for purposes of today's hearing.
State and County find the collequy sufficient.
Court Accepts/Approves the defendant's oral waiver of medical privilege.

Atty. Haines requests to be excused. Court Grants. Atty. Haines excused @ 10:52 am.

State files a letter of Treatment and Care provided to the defendant authored by Captain Schnabl of the Jail.
Atty. Patrickus presented oral arguments to the court.
State objects and presented oral arguments to the court.
Defense presented a response.

Court Denies - Defense Motion for Bail Modification.
Reasons placed on the record.
Court signed order denying Defense Motin for Bail Modification.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.

Bail and Conditions remain as previously fixed.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin and Assistant Attorney General Richard Duford also appears on behalf of the state.  Albanian interpreter Sonny Zhaferi appears as interpreter and is sworn-in.   Case called for oral ruling.  Assistant Attorney General Duford makes statements.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements prior to the court's ruling.  Court recites case history on both cases.  Court finds Dr. Garcia's testimony to be more credible and adopts her findings and conclusions as stated in her report.  Court finds Defendant competent to proceed.   This case is to be set for preliminary hearing.  Attorney Patrickus requests that bail be addressed and makes staterments regarding bail.  Court states it will require a written motion regarding Attorney Patrickus' request(s).  State states that issues being raised are to go through Corporation Counsel's office.  Preliminary hearing scheduled within 10 days. Attorney Patrickus goes beyond 10 days due to scheduling conflict.  Due to court's finding of competency, Defendant is released from his comittment at Mendota and is to remain in Waukesha County jail.   Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing (preliminary hearing).   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
(Fax) Defendant's supplemental summary of evidentiary points and authorities relative to lack of competency to stand trial. Filed by Atty Patrickus.
Motion in support of Defendant's competency. Filed by the State.
Oral ruling on August 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Garcia appears by videoconference from Mendota.  Albanian interpreter Sonny Zhaferi is sworn-in as interpreter.  Case called for sur-rebuttal on competency hearing.  Dr. Basil Jackson is sworn-in to testify.  Cross-examination by the state.  Re-direct by Attorney Patrickus. State requests that Dr. Garcia testify by providing an update to anything regarding Mr. Islami since her last testimony.  Dr. Garcia is sworn-in and testifies.  No cross-examination.  Testimony is closed.  Court orders the state and defense to provide any arguments in writing and to file such submissions by 7/3/15, end of business day.  Court sets case for oral ruling.  Court receives exhibits #31-35.  Oral ruling scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.
Defendant's Summary of Evidentiary Points and Authorities Relative to Lack of Competency to Proceed to Trial
Excerpt of Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 05/11/15 competency hearing at 10am.
Competency hearing on June 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Albanian Interpreter Sonny Xhaferi appears and is sworn-in as interpreter for Defendant. Case called for continued competency hearing, continued from May 4, 2015.  Dr. Garcia appears by videoconference from Mendota.  Attorney Patrickus filed motion (Defendant's Objection and Memorandum to Exculde from Admission into Evidence Out of Court Statements of Medical Staff Allegedly Contained in Uncertified Medical Records) with the court at 10:15 a.m. (faxed at 10:00 p.m. on 5/10/15).  Court reviewed motion.  Attorney Patrickus makes statements regarding her motion.  State makes statements regarding motion. Attorney Patrickus makes additional statements.  Court denies motion.  Dr. Garcia, appearing by videoconference, is sworn-in and testifies (called on rebuttal by the state).   Cross-examination by Attorney Patrickus.  Re-direct by the state.  Attorney Patrickus states she wishes to call Dr. Jackson on surrebutal.    State objects. Court will allow testimony on surrebuttal from Dr. Jackson but adjourns due to the late hour (1:25 pm.) and having an afternoon calendar.  Bail remains as fixed.   Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing - Sonny Zhaferi.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.  Defendant to be transported from Mendota to Waukesha County jail for 6/15/15 court date.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Assistant District Attorney Andrea M. Will and Assistant Attorney General Richard Duford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's exhibits #31-33 marked.   Case called at 8:45 a.m. for continued testimony on competency hearing.  Interpreter Sonny Xhaferi is sworn-in as Albanian interpreter.  Dr. Garcia appears by videoconference to hear/listen to testimony on cross-examination of Dr. Basil Jackson.  Defense stipulates as to transcript marked as Exhibit #33.  Dr. Basil Jackson is sworn-in and cross-examined by the state.  State's exhibit #34 marked. Court takes short break at 10:10 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:30 a.m.  State continues with cross-examination.  Re-direct by Attorney Patrickus.  Re-cross-examination by the state.  Court adjourns due to late hour (12:25 p.m.).  DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH.  Defendant to be produced for next court date from Mendota.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea M. Will and Assistant Attorney General Richard Dufour appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Albanian Interpreter Asan Xhaferi appears as interpreter for Defendant.  Interpreter is sworn-in.  Defense Exhibit #9 is marked.  Case proceeds to testimony.  Court inquires of Defendant if he believes he is competent or incompetent.  Defendant states he is not competent to proceed.  State calls Dr. Ana Garcia to testify by videoconference from Mendota Mental Health Institute.  Dr. Ana Garcia appears by videoconference and is sworn-in and testifies.  Assistant Attorney General Richard Dufour examines/questions Dr. Garcia.  State's Exhibit #10 marked. State moves for admission of Exhibit #10.  Court receives Exhibit #10.   Cross-examination by Attorney Patrickus.  Re-direct by Attorney Dufour.  Re-cross examination by Attorney Patrickus.  Court takes 10 minute adjournment.  Court reconvenes at 4:25 p.m.  Parties state that next witness will be very lengthy as well.  Court adjourns due to late hour.  Defendant to be returned to Mendota forthwith.  Defendant to appear in person for next court date for continued competency hearing on 1/28/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Albanian Interpreter Asan Xhaferi available to appear.  Competency hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ydbi Islami appears by videoconference from Mendota Mental Health Center, in custody.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appears in court on behalf of Defendant.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing.  State requests that Dr. Garcia be able to appear by videoconference on 12/15/14.  Court grants request.  Attorney Patrickus states that her examining doctor will be seeing Defendant this weekend.  Court keeps hearing on for 12/15/14.  DEFENDANT NEEDS AN ALBANIAN INTERPRETER for 12/15/14.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus. Andrea M. Will and Richard Duford from the Department of Justice appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that case has been reassigned to Branch 4 from Branch 9 due to recusal. Case called for contested Competency hearing. State moves for exclusion of witnesses. Court grants request. Remaining witnesses leave the Courtroom. Dr. Anna Garcia sworn in and testifies under direct examination, cross examination, re direct, re cross. Exhibits 1-8, marked, offered, and received by the Court. Exhibit 7 received over objection. Dr. Garcia excused by the Court. State rests. Defense called Atty Joseph Owens to the stand, objection by the State. Defense rests. Closing arguments by both counsel. Court finds that the defendant is not competent but is likely to gain competency within the statutory time period. Court orders defendant committed to Mendota Mental Health Facility for treatment to competency. Court orders periodic reports to be filed. Proceedings are suspended until defendant regains competency. All exhibits to be sealed.
Competency hearing on August 19, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: From Atty Patrickus, requesting the Court to recuse itself.

Defendant Ydbi Islami in court, in custody, with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.   Andrea Will and District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chris Koehnke appeared on Village of Lac La Belle. Motion for protective order and competency addressed. Village intends to raze the building. The date has now been postponed. Atty. Patrickus requests an injunction. Competency hearing witnesses addressed. Court doesn't find any basis to delay the razing. Court declines the request of an injunction. Motion may be renewed by Defense.  Case continued as set.  Dr. Garcia to appear in person on the next date. Competency is on both cases.
